newsitem.title: BELGIUM: SGB says sold most of Elf stake.
newsitem.headline: SGB says sold most of Elf stake.

text.p: Belgian holding company Societe Generale de Belgique sold most of its 1.33 percent stake in French oil group Elf, a SGB spokesman told Reuters on Thursday.
He gave no details of the transaction. SGB financial officers were unavailable for comment because they were at a company roadshow in London on Thursday.

Paris-based analysts said earlier they were told at a separate roadshow this week that the sale concerned at least four fifths of the 1.33 percent stake, or in other words, at least 84 percent of SGB's 3.6 million Elf shares.
SGB said earlier this year its Elf stake, bought at the time of Elf's 1994 privatisation, was up for sale because it wanted to divest its minor holdings.
Elf said earlier this week it had sold 2.9 percent of France's Cie de Suez to Belgian holding company Electrafina, a unit of financier Albert Frere's Groupe Bruxelles Lambert.
SGB is 62.6 percent owned by Suez.
